skillTree.name: Unfathomable Presence
skillTree.description: The Mage-Priest's thought patterns are so alien that they are even beyond the perception of enemy Wizards.

effects.description: Barrier hit points: +800

skillTree.name: Becalming Cogitation
skillTree.description: Contemplation is the path to alignment, to the correct interpretation of the Great Plan.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -50% when increasing
	(local region)

skillTree.name: The Harrowing Scrutiny
skillTree.description: Within the Slann's gaze shines the cold-blooded scrutiny of the Old Ones.

effects.description:
Control: +3
	(local province)
Attribute: Causes Terror

skillTree.name: Arcane Convergence
skillTree.description: All shall be one, as it is written.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +20% when increasing

skillTree.name: Transcendent Healing
skillTree.description: When wounded, the Slann's sheer force of will literally recombines his body.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Regeneration"

skillTree.name: Higher State of Consciousness
skillTree.description: "Everywhere we shine, death and life burn into something newâ€¦"

effects.description: Barrier replenishment delay: -50%

skillTree.name: Telekinesis
skillTree.description: The power to move objects without touching them makes missiles attacks against this one largely pointless.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 15%

skillTree.name: Protection of the Old Ones
skillTree.description: Across the gulf of space, the serene Potec has shared the secrets of time so that the Lizardmen may protect themselves against supernatural attack.

effects.description: Spell resistance: 10%

skillTree.name: Guardian Mist
skillTree.description: Lord Huinitenuchli is the creator and the teacher of the Guardian Mist, a magical mist protecting Xlanhuapec and its surroundings from invaders.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Master of Mists"

Campaign movement range: -10%
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.name: Master of Elemental Magic
skillTree.description: The Slann is especially skilled in the elemental magical arts, his very words turn to creeping vapour, filling his chamber with cloying fog and spreading forth to encompass the entire city.

effects.description: Ability: "Mist of the Damned"

Reinforces the Geomantic Web to level 3, indirectly improving commandments
	(local province)
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for all spells

skillTree.name: Veteran of Pahuax
skillTree.description: Lord Huinitenuchli defeated a Slaaneshi Daemon Prince referred to in the archives as 'the nether-thing of the second moon' during the Great Catastrophe, though the Slann's body was grievously wounded and he took many years to recover from the harm done to him.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 when fighting against Chaos and Norsca
	(all units in army)

Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Chaos and Norsca
	(all units in army)
Passive ability: "Exorcism"

skillTree.name: Shrouded Warriors
skillTree.description: For its own protection, the entire city of Xlanhuapec is perpetually wreathed in banks of coiling mist and it is possible to pass within a few yards of its boundary stones without noting the cityâ€™s sprawling presence, so thick are those swirling vapours.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk for Saurus and Skink Infantry units
	(all units in army)

Magic resistance: 15% for Saurus and Skink Infantry units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.name: They Should Not Be Here
skillTree.description: According to his most senior Skink Priest attendant, these words were said by Lord Huinitenuchli when the first Elves to enter Lustria were brought before him

backgroundSkills.name: Revered Being
backgroundSkills.description: There are few slann mage-priests left upon the world from the Second Spawning. Lord Huinitenuchli is one such revered being.

items.name: Plaque of Shrouded Mists
items.description: Plaque of Shrouded Mists is an ancient stone relic carved before the second spawning of the Slann that contains elements of the Old Onesâ€™ own, indecipherable, language. The unfathomable power contained within these graven images is enough to cause the unwary to go mad, and simply by glancing at the glyphs, unprepared minds can be shocked into a bewildering stupor as the insignificance of their puny lives on the cosmic scales of the Old Ones is relentlessly forced into their minds.
